definitions.example: 1605: I could as well be brought / To knee his throne and, squire-like, pension beg / To keep base life afoot. — William Shakespeare, King Lear II.ii

definitions.definition: To poke or strike with the knee.
To move on the knees; to use the knees to move.
Having a knee or knees, or, in combination, the stated type of knee or knees.
definitions.example: a kneed biped, a knobbly-kneed boy

definitions.definition: Having angular joints like the knee.
